member.name: POLYTEXTA
member.summary: The POLYTEXT structure describes how the function should draw a string of text.

member.name: POLYTEXTA.x
member.summary: The horizontal reference point for the string. The string is aligned to this point using the current text-alignment mode.

member.name: POLYTEXTA.y
member.summary: The vertical reference point for the string. The string is aligned to this point using the current text-alignment mode.

member.name: POLYTEXTA.n
member.summary: The length of the string pointed to by lpstr.

member.name: POLYTEXTA.lpstr
member.summary: Pointer to a string of text to be drawn by the function. This string need not be null-terminated, since n specifies the length of the string.

summary.para: Specifies whether the string is to be opaque or clipped and whether the string is accompanied by an array of character-width values. This member can be one or more of the following values.

listheader.description: The rectangle for each string is to be opaqued with the current background color.
Each string is to be clipped to its specified rectangle.

member.name: POLYTEXTA.rcl
member.summary: A rectangle structure that contains the dimensions of the opaquing or clipping rectangle. This member is ignored if neither of the ETO_OPAQUE nor the ETO_CLIPPED value is specified for the uiFlags member.

member.name: POLYTEXTA.pdx
member.summary: Pointer to an array containing the width value for each character in the string.
